result.execSummary:
The defendant Myron L. Hodges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with T.H., her family, or her residence. 
No contact with B.H., her family, or her residence (In the event of a Divorce proceeding- the Defendant may have contact with B.H. for the sole purposes of the Divorce proceedings, unless B.H. hires an attorney). 
Not to consume or possess any alcohol, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia, or prescription drugs not prescribed to you. 
No entry into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, or place where the primary purpose is the sale or consumption of alcohol. 
Not to own pets without prior written permission from the agent.

Complete Domestic Violence Programming. 
Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and follow through with any and all recommendations.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Assocaited with Count 1.
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

10:29 AM; Cases called 14CF799 and 18CF1733. Defendant Myron L. Hodges in custody with Attorney George E. Miller. Attorney Loralee Clark appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Christina Anderson Probation Agent appears. 
Defense lists numerous corrections to the Pre-Sentence Investigation. Victim/Witness statute complied with. State argues sentence recommendation. Defense argues sentence recommendation. State makes a statement. Defense makes a statement. Defendant makes a statement. 
Court orders in 14CF799 Count 1- 1 year and 6 months initial confinement with 2 years of extended supervision. Count 2- 9 months jail- concurrent to Count 1. 
Court orders in 18CF1733 Count 1- 1 year and 6 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision. Count 6- 1 year and 6 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision- concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to 14CF799. Count 8- 2 years of initial confinement with 3 years of extended supervision- consecutive to Counts 1 and 6. 
Court orders the following conditions of extended supervision: No contact with T.H., her family, or her residence; No contact with B.H., her family, or her residence.( In the event of a Divorce proceeding- the Defendant may have contact with B.H. for the sole purposes of the Divorce proceedings, unless B.H. hires an attorney); Not to consume or possess any alcohol, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia, or prescription drugs not prescribed to you; No entry into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, or place where the primary purpose is the sale or consumption of alcohol; Not to own pets without prior written permission from the agent; AODA and follow through with any and all recommendations; Complete Domestic Violence Programming. Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge. Court costs. 
Defendant is not eligible for either the Challenge Incarnation Program or the Substance Abuse Program. Court orders 213 days credit.
*CONFIDENTIAL*
*CONFIDENTIAL*
Defendant's Alternate Presentence Investigation
Sentencing hearing on June 14, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Removing Repeater enhancer on Count 1

03:02 PM.  Also called:  18CF1733.   Defendant Myron L. Hodges in court with Attorney George E. Miller.  Defendant Myron L. Hodges in custody.  Loralee Clark appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Agreement has been reached.   Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant pleads  No Contest in 18CF1733 to Count 1, 6 and 8 as charged and in 14CF799 defendant pleads to Count 1 w/o repeater and Count 2 w/repeater.     Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Prior acknowledged.    Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.  PSI ordered and both parties are free to argue at sentencing. 3:19 off the record for scheduling.  3:21 On the record.   Sentencing  6-14-19 at 10:30 am. for one hour. Attorney Miller states an alternative PSI will be prepared.   Bond revoked.

2:33 p.m.    Defendant Myron Lanell Hodges in court with Attorney George E. Miller.  Defendant Myron Lanell Hodges in custody.  Loralee Clark appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls:   Investigator Scott Kelley, Altoona PD.  He is sworn in and testifies. Cross -examined by Attorney Miller.  Redirect by State. Recross by Attorney Miller.    Court finds probable cause and binds case over to Branch 5

(Cases called at 11:18 AM- 14CF799 and 18CF1733)
Defendant Myron Hodges appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Mark Austin.  Attorney Loralee Clark appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrant executed in 14CF799.  Defense waives reading of Complaints.  State requests $100,000 cash bond- defendant has 10 violent offense convictions.  State plans to file fugitive complaint from Minnesota.  Defense argues against cash bond- defendant has nothing to post. 
Preliminary hearing: 11/27/18 at 2:30 PM
